intro: Agelanthus natalitius subsp. zeyheri, commonly known as Natal agelanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal sand dunes and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. It is a perennial species that produces distinctive, urn-shaped inflorescences. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic plant in its native range.
